title: Calories in Potato Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in potato soup per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and recipe tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Creamy potato soup made with potatoes, cream, onions, butter; standard homemade recipe, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, cream content, and portion size. Check labels for canned or restaurant versions.

quick_answer.text: One cup of creamy potato soup contains about 250 kcal and 30 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use low-fat milk instead of cream
Add 1 oz shredded cheddar per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of potato soup?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard creamy serving.

faqs.q: Is potato soup high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, often around 800 mg per cup due to broth and seasonings.

faqs.q: What's the protein in potato soup?
faqs.a: About 5 g per cup, mostly from dairy if creamy.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in potato soup?
faqs.a: Opt for low-fat dairy, more veggies, or broth-based instead of cream.

faqs.q: Carbs in potato soup per serving?
faqs.a: Roughly 30 g carbs per cup, mainly from potatoes.
